bibl.title: Marie Le Fevre, Yvonne Le Fevre, & Georgette Normand v. M. Angelique. Petition
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the Superior Court of King County State of Washington
In the atter of the application of Yvonne Le fevre and Georgette Normand Marie Le Fevre for a writ of Habeas Corpus} PETITION
To the Honorable judges of the above entitled court: Your petitioner, H.C.Gill, respectfully petitions and shows to the Court as follows:-
That he is one of the attorneys for the above named Yvonne Le Fevre, Marie Le Fevre and Georgette Normand, and make this petition and application in the behalf.

That the above named Yvonne LeFevre, Marie LeFevre and Georgette Normand are restrained of thier liberty by the House of the Good Shepard, a religious inastitution in the City of Seattle, and by sister M.Angelique, the Sister Superior thereof.

That the cause or pretense of the saidrestraint and unlawful detention of the said Yvonne LeFevre Marie LeFevre and Georgette Normand is, according to the best knowledge and belief of your petitioner and applicant, a request from the Honorable P. Lavin, a United States Emigration Inspector, that they be so restrained.

That the said restraint is ellegal, and theillegality thereof consists on this, That the said Yvonne LeFevre, Marie LeFevre and Georgette Normand are not held by virtue of any lawfully issued
warrant or process from any court; and further in that thesaid house of the Good Shepard and the Sister Superior therof have no lawful authority form any state or from the United States of America to restrain the persons the said Yvonne Le Fecre, Marie LeFevre and Georgette Normand.

WHEREFORE your petitioner prays that an order for a Writ of Habeas Corpus be issued herin directing the said M.Angelique to have and produce before this court at a time and place to be fixed by the Court to do and receive what shall be ordered concerning the said Yvonne LeFecre and Georgette Normand, and to have then and there the said writ.
H.C. Gill Petitioner Gill Hoyt & Frye Attys for petitioner
State of Washington, County of King ss

H.C. GILL, being first dully sworn on oath says; that the is the petitioner in the above entitled action; that he has heard the forgoing petition read, onows the contents therof, and belives the same to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 11th day of Febuary, A.D. 1903. Herman S. Frye Notary Publicin and for the State of Wshington residing at Seattle.
